reading_passages.title: About Russia and the Caucasus
reading_passages.text: Lesson 1 Big Idea Russia is big and cold with vast plains and forests, while the Caucasus features rugged mountains with seas to the east and west. Main Ideas •The physical features of Russia and the Caucasus include plains, mountains, and rivers.
reading_passages.main_idea: Lesson 1 Big Idea Russia is big and cold with vast plains and forests, while the Caucasus features rugged mountains with seas to the east and west.
supporting_details: Main Ideas •The physical features of Russia and the Caucasus include plains, mountains, and rivers.

reading_passages.title: About Russia and the Caucasus
reading_passages.text: Russia’s cold climate contrasts sharply with the warmer Caucasus.
reading_passages.main_idea: Russia’s cold climate contrasts sharply with the warmer Caucasus.

reading_passages.title: About Russia and the Caucasus
reading_passages.text: Lesson 2 Big Idea Strict rule, unrest, and ethnic diversity have shaped Russia’s history and culture. Today, it faces many challenges. Main Ideas •The Russian Empire grew under powerful leaders, but unrest and war led to its end.
reading_passages.main_idea: Lesson 2 Big Idea Strict rule, unrest, and ethnic diversity have shaped Russia’s history and culture.
supporting_details: Main Ideas •The Russian Empire grew under powerful leaders, but unrest and war led to its end.

scientific_phenomena.title: Russia and the Caucasus Landform
scientific_phenomena.description: As the map shows, Russia’s landforms vary from west to east. The Northern European Plain stretches across western, or European, Russia. This fertile plain forms Russia’s heartland, where most Russians live.

writing_prompts: Using information from the passage and your own knowledge, write an informative paragraph about Russia and the Caucasus. Include at least three vocabulary terms from Part 1.
Describe an important geographic feature of Russia and the Caucasus and explain its significance to the region.
Compare and contrast two aspects of Russia and the Caucasus discussed in the reading passage.

What questions do you still have about Russia and the Caucasus?
How does learning about Russia and the Caucasus help you understand our world better?
How might life in Russia and the Caucasus be similar to or different from your own?
